works.complaint:
Dear Sir or Madam:

I would like the following review (more like trash comment) removed from  
our official, Rundles Restaurant and Bistro Google business page:

"imysam ‎ - 25 Mar, 2012
After cancelling my reservation because I was ill following chemotherapy, I  
received an email from Mr. Maloney, telling me not to waste his time in the  
future, He also told me to enjoy eating fast food in my future visits to  
Stratford. If you want to avoid this rude, pompous, self-important  
environment, you might want to avoid Rundles."

This person was completely rude to me over the phone, asking for a  
reservation we could not deliver.  They were not in their right mind  
dealing with me, so, I told them where to go.  This is perfectly my right  
to do so.  I can accept or deny reservations, as I see fit, under the laws  
here in Canada.

Why you should glorify such a negative posting by such a Google user  
like "imysam", is beyond me.

This posting by "imysam" goes beyond what is normal, and it is not a review  
of our restaurant nor restuarant services.  "imysam" should have posted in  
a rubbish gossip column, like Chowhound.com, and not on an official  
restaurant review page like yours.  TripAdvisor would never allow such a  
negative posting as you have allowed from "imysam".  Plus, I am upset you  
and your progammers decided to highlight it is a top ranking review.  You  
seem to be highlighting anti-restaurant reviews, or, what we see as a form  
of restaurant-bashing.  This is unacceptable behaviour, and unlawful.

Again, I want this review removed as soon as possible, it does not belong  
on Google, because I think it damages your editorial integrity and image in  
the end.  Right now, I am already thinking Google is going downhill, if,  
you feature such crap reporting.

And oblige,

Richard Maloney
